item.title: 大科技公司的人工智能竞赛正在挤压中产阶级程序员的生存空间
item.description: 欢迎收看《深度科技》（Tech In Depth），这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日时事通讯。今天，弗拉德-萨沃夫（Vlad Savov）将解释大科技公司积极的人工智能招聘热潮对努力保住饭碗的普通工程师意味着什么。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Vlad Savov explains what Big Tech’s aggressive AI hiring spree means for regular engineers trying to stay employed.】

item.title: 日本大选再次下调财政纪律评级
item.description: 我是克里斯-安斯蒂，波士顿的经济编辑。今天我们将探讨日本周日大选对经济政策的影响。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Chris Anstey, an economics editor in Boston. Today we’re looking at the economic policy implications of Sunday’s election in Japan. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 美国银行称 2025 年美股在全球资金流中的份额大幅下降
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp.）的策略师们表示，由于贸易战引发了人们对所谓的美国例外论的怀疑，2025 年流向美国的全球股市份额急剧下降。【原文：The share of global equity flows heading to the US has plunged in 2025, strategists at Bank of America Corp. said, as the trade war raises doubts about so-called American exceptionalism.】

item.title: 美国制定稳定币规则，加密货币价值突破 4 万亿美元
item.description:
立法者通过立法，明确了对稳定币的监管。【原文：

Lawmakers passed legislation that provides regulatory clarity on stablecoins.

】

item.title: 贝森特告诉石破茂，日美可以达成良好的贸易协议
item.description: 日本首相石破茂说，美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特告诉他，两国将能够达成一项良好的贸易协议。【原文：Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba said that US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent told him that the two nations will be able to reach a good trade deal.】

item.title: 欧洲央行在未来危机中将选择贷款工具而非量化宽松政策
item.description: 彭博社对经济学家进行的一项调查显示，在未来几乎所有需要采取非常规应对措施的情况下，欧洲央行都会选择向银行贷款，而不是购买债券。【原文：The European Central Bank will pick lending to banks over bond-buying in almost all future situations that require unconventional responses, according to a Bloomberg poll of economists.】

item.title: KoBold 签订刚果勘探协议，促进美国矿产资源的获取
item.description: KoBold Metals 公司与刚果民主共和国签署了一项矿产勘探协议，深化了该公司在非洲中部国家的活动。【原文：KoBold Metals and the Democratic Republic of Congo signed a mineral exploration pact, deepening the company’s activities in the central African nation.】

item.title: 丰厚红利诱惑投资者投资落后的高收益股票
item.description: 在今年晚些时候的降息预期到来之前，投资者纷纷涌入提供高股息的股票，因为这些股票往往表现不佳。【原文：Investors are piling into stocks that offer high dividends, drawn by the lure of chunky payouts in the often-underperforming group ahead of expected interest-rate cuts later this year.】

item.title: 欧盟同意与海湾国家就战略关系展开会谈
item.description: 欧盟成员国批准启动与六个海湾国家的谈判，因为在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普发出关税威胁之际，欧盟正努力扩大其国际伙伴关系。【原文：European Union member states approved the launch of negotiations with six Gulf countries as the bloc seeks to broaden its international partnerships amid tariff threats from President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 华伦天奴老板否认出售意大利时装品牌的计划
item.description: 华伦天奴（Valentino）的多数股权所有者否认了报纸关于其计划与合作伙伴开云集团（Kering SA）一起出售这家意大利时装屋的报道。【原文：The majority owner of Valentino denied a newspaper report that it plans to sell the Italian fashion house alongside partner Kering SA.】

item.title: 东京都区努力遏制房价飙升中的公寓转售行为
item.description: 东京不断飙升的房价促使该市的一个中心区采取了罕见的干预措施，当地官员试图通过控制转售来冷却市场。【原文：Soaring property prices in Tokyo have prompted a rare intervention by one of the city’s central wards, as local officials seek to cool the market by reining in resales.】

item.title: 英伟达涨势出现过热迹象，涨幅突破 80
item.description: 英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp. ）的交易员不断获得买入该股的理由，但突破性的涨势正显示出过热的迹象。【原文：Nvidia Corp. traders keep getting reasons to buy the stock, but the breakneck rally is showing signs of overheating.】

item.title: 欧洲对印度纳亚拉能源公司的制裁使其销售面临风险
item.description: 俄罗斯能源巨头俄罗斯石油公司（Rosneft）出售印度纳亚拉能源有限公司（Nayara Energy Ltd.）股份的计划可能会受到欧盟新限制措施的影响。【原文：Russian energy giant Rosneft’s plan to sell its stake in India-based Nayara Energy Ltd. may be imperiled by fresh restrictions from the European Union.】

item.title: 对冲基金争夺创纪录数量的伦敦办公空间
item.description: 对冲基金正在伦敦寻找创纪录数量的办公空间，以适应其在一段丰厚回报期后的扩张。【原文：Hedge funds are looking for a record amount of office space in London to accommodate their expansion after a period of bumper returns.】

item.title: 纳格尔称，美联储独立性面临的挑战在美国之外引起反响
item.description: 德国央行行长约阿希姆-纳格尔（Joachim Nagel）表示，美国以外的国家也会感受到对美联储独立性的干预。【原文：Interference in the independence of the Federal Reserve would be felt outside of the US, according to Bundesbank President Joachim Nagel.】

item.title: 西班牙不良贷款银行开始出售 15 亿欧元不良贷款
item.description: 西班牙的不良贷款银行计划出售约 15 亿欧元（17.5 亿美元）的不良贷款组合。【原文：Spain’s bad bank plans to sell a portfolio of about €1.5 billion ($1.75 billion) in soured loans.】

item.title: 阿塞拜疆基金将购买 Enfinity 在意大利的 49% 太阳能资产
item.description: 阿塞拜疆主权财富基金 SOFAZ 将收购 Enfinity Global Inc.【原文：Azerbaijan’s sovereign wealth fund SOFAZ is set to buy a stake in Enfinity Global Inc.’s solar power assets in Italy in further step to expand its investments in the country.】

item.title: 萨博首席执行官认为订单渠道将使今年以后的销售受益
item.description: 萨博公司首席执行官表示，该瑞典防务公司的目标是在今年敲定鹰狮战斗机和全球鹰预警机的订单，并已上调了 2025 年的销售增长预期。【原文：The chief executive officer of Saab AB says the Swedish defense company is aiming to finalize orders for its Gripen fighter jets and Globaleye early-warning aircraft this year, having already raised the forecast for sales growth in 2025.】

item.title: 日股交易清淡显示高风险投票前的不安情绪
item.description: 在本周末可能造成混乱的上议院选举之前，日本股票交易商的交易量有所萎缩。【原文：Traders of Japanese stocks saw transaction volumes shrinking in the run-up to this weekend’s potentially disruptive upper house election.】

item.title: 澳大利亚监管机构调查 200 亿美元私人信贷经理人
item.description: 据知情人士透露，澳大利亚企业监管部门正在对私人信贷管理公司 Metrics Credit Partners Pty 进行审查，因为在更广泛的行业调查中，出现了对贷款估值和管理方法的担忧。【原文：Australia’s corporate watchdog is scrutinizing private credit manager Metrics Credit Partners Pty because of concerns over loan valuations and governance practices that have emerged as part of a broader industry probe, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 台湾旨在通过技术出口管制确保自身安全
item.description: 台湾正试图通过对一些大型中国公司实施某些出口限制，确保国内制造的技术不被用于危害其人民的安全。【原文：Taiwan is trying to ensure that technology built domestically is not used to compromise the security of its people by imposing certain export curbs on a number of major Chinese companies.】

item.title: 法国市场监管机构下令维旺迪撤回要约
item.description: 法国市场监管机构裁定，Bolloré SE 和 Vincent Bolloré 必须在未来六个月内公开撤回对 Vivendi SE 的收购要约，这对控制该公司的媒体亿万富翁是一个打击。【原文：France’s markets regulator ruled that Bolloré SE and Vincent Bolloré are required to make a public withdrawal offer on Vivendi SE in the next six months, in a blow to the media billionaire who controls the company.】

item.title: 埃里克-亚当斯市长谈纽约市的未来
item.description:
他解决城市最大挑战的愿景

His vision for solving the city's biggest challenges

】

item.title: 奇货可居：亚当斯市长谈纽约市的未来（播客）
item.description: 奇货可居：亚当斯市长谈纽约市的未来（播客）【原文：Odd Lots: Mayor Adams on the Future of New York City (Podcast)】

item.title: Zara 创始人疯狂交易，为 1040 亿美元避税
item.description: Zara 创始人阿曼西奥-奥尔特加（Amancio Ortega）的私人投资公司正在全球范围内大肆进行交易，最近几周收购了一连串有价值的资产，因为他正试图利用其不断扩大的财富来规避财富税。【原文：Zara founder Amancio Ortega’s private investment firm is on a global deal spree, picking up a string of trophy assets in recent weeks as he seeks to deploy his expanding fortune to avoid wealth taxes.】

item.title: 中国风险投资基金吸引全球投资者 20 亿美元卷土重来
item.description: 中国最大的风险投资公司正在市场上募集至少 20 亿美元的新资金，重新与中国的初创企业合作，这表明全球投资者对从人工智能到玩具等领域的投资兴趣重新燃起。【原文：China’s largest venture capital houses are tapping the market for at least $2 billion in new funds, re-engaging with the country’s startups in a signal of renewed global investor interest in areas from AI to toys.】

item.title: 泰国财政部长认为美国将根据新提案削减 36% 的关税
item.description: 泰国财政部长披差-春哈瓦吉拉（Pichai Chunhavajira）表示，在新一轮谈判中提出 "非常实质性的改进 "后，泰国希望美国将对其出口产品征收的关税从 36% 降至与地区邻国一致的水平。【原文：Thailand expects the US to reduce a threatened tariff on its exports from 36% to a level in line with regional neighbors after presenting a “very substantial improvement” in a fresh round of talks, Finance Minister Pichai Chunhavajira said.】

item.title: 小卖部、海滩棚屋和高山小屋：阿尔巴尼亚打击非法建筑
item.description:
当局希望拆除在 1991 年共产主义崩溃后的混乱时期未经许可建造的建筑物。【原文：

Authorities want to tear down structures built without permission during the mayhem that followed the collapse of communism in 1991.

】

item.title: 日本借助 Rapidus 的首款芯片原型向人工智能目标迈进
item.description: 日本 Rapidus 公司研制出了一种先进的芯片原型，这是这家由政府支持的初创企业在数十亿美元公共资金的帮助下，试图跨越多年创新历程的第一步。【原文：Japan’s Rapidus Corp. has prototyped an advanced chip, an early step in the government-backed startup’s attempt to leapfrog years of innovation with the help of billions of dollars in public funding.】

item.title: 芯片设计商 Semifive 申请韩国上市前审查
item.description: 芯片设计公司 Semifive Inc. 在首尔提交了首次公开募股的初步申请，寻求刺激公司发展，以满足人工智能等领域对半导体不断增长的需求。【原文：Chip design firm Semifive Inc. filed a preliminary application for an initial public offering in Seoul, seeking to spur its growth to tap rising demand for semiconductors in fields such as artificial intelligence.】
